news.title: Facebook Plans Launch of Its Own “Supreme Court” for Handling Takedown Appeals
news.description: Facebook’s new Oversight Board will reportedly operate independently of the social media giant, and will have powers including directing the company to allow or remove content.

news.title: LinkedIn Now Has a Way for Users to Verify Their Skills
news.description: LinkedIn is offering professionals an array of skill assessments for things like software and coding languages as a means of demonstrating proficiency to prospective employers.

news.title: Instagram Posts Can Now Be Scheduled In Advance Through Facebook
news.description: Facebook business account holders now have the ability to use those accounts to schedule Instagram posts and IGTV videos up to six months ahead of time.

news.title: YouTube Says It Has Removed More Than 100K Videos Under New Hate Speech Rules
news.description: Pursuant to YouTube’s new policy against hate speech, the video-sharing platform has taken down more than 17,000 channels, 100,000 videos, and 500 million comments.
